document_type: Collection of Memos, Cables, and Project Approvals
security: Several documents discuss ongoing operational activities, cover mechanisms (ICAP, WUSALINE), and agent details (TICHBORN, HARRIOTT, AMANTHEM/1). Revealing this information could compromise operations, expose agents, and damage relationships with cover entities. As an example, one document discusses using WUSALINE as cover: "...WUSALINE'S EXCELLENT CONTACTS IN THE WOLADY BUSINESS COMMUNITY COULD PROBABLY PRODUCE SUFFICIENT BUSINESS TO JUSTIFY SUCH AN ASSIGNMENT..."
summary: This collection of documents pertains to Edward G. TICHBORN, a contract agent involved in political action and operational surveys for the CIA, particularly in Latin America and Spain; it includes memos regarding his operational activities, financial matters, project approvals, and a transfer of operational responsibility from WHD to DODS.
summary_one_paragraph: This collection contains memos, cables, and project approval requests related to Edward G. TICHBORN (aka Henry R. Lopez), a CIA contract agent. These documents detail TICHBORN's operational surveys in Spain, his role as a political action advisor, financial matters including travel expenses and indebtedness, and the transfer of his operational responsibility from the Western Hemisphere Division (WHD) to the Directorate of Operations/Covert Operations (DODS). It also includes project extensions and terminations related to TICHBORNâ€™s support, noting his cover employment with WUSALINE and ICAP Iberia.
title: Edward G. TICHBORN (Henry P. Lopez) Files: Operational Activities and Project Management
